Example of journal’s templates

Source: vignettes/articles/examples.Rmd
examples.Rmd

List of templates

The examples below illustrate all the article’s template included into this package.

library(htmltools)
thumbs <- function(ncol = 2, title, href, img, source, fun) {
  div(class = sprintf("col-sm-%s", 12/ncol), 
      h2(title),
      pre(class = c("sourceCode", "yaml"), 
                    code(class = c("sourceCode", "yaml"), 
                         sprintf("output: %s", fun))),
      a(class = "thumbnail", 
        title = title, href = href, img(src = img)),
      a(class = "source-repo", href = source, "Source of template")
  )
}
quillt::thumbnails(lapply(articles, function(x) {
    thumbs(title = x$title, img = x$img, 
           href = x$href, ncol = 2, source = x$source, 
           fun = x$fun)
  }), ncol = 2)
str(lapply(articles, function(x) {
    thumbs(title = x$title, img = x$img, 
           href = x$href, ncol = 2, source = x$source, 
           fun = x$fun)}))

Contents

rticles is built for R Markdown, an ecosystem of packages for creating computational documents in R. Learn more at rmarkdown.rstudio.com.

Developed by JJ Allaire, Yihui Xie, R Foundation, Hadley Wickham, Journal of Statistical Software, Ramnath Vaidyanathan, Association for Computing Machinery, Carl Boettiger, Elsevier, Karl Broman, Kirill Mueller, Bastiaan Quast, Randall Pruim, Ben Marwick, Charlotte Wickham, Oliver Keyes, Miao Yu, Daniel Emaasit, Thierry Onkelinx, Alessandro Gasparini, Marc-Andre Desautels, Dominik Leutnant, MDPI, Taylor and Francis, Oğuzhan Öğreden, Dalton Hance, Daniel Nüst, Petter Uvesten, Elio Campitelli, John Muschelli, Alex Hayes, Zhian N. Kamvar, Noam Ross, Robrecht Cannoodt, Duncan Luguern, David M. Kaplan, Sebastian Kreutzer, Shixiang Wang, Jay Hesselberth, Christophe Dervieux. Site built with pkgdown.
